things.thing

Class ThingControlMinimal

  • java.lang.Object
    • things.thing.ThingControlMinimal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThingControlReactive

    public class ThingControlMinimal
extends Object

    Minimal implementation of a central class that manages all things related, well…, things…

    Minimal means there are no utility/convenience methods, and this is the only control class that talks to the registered ThingReader, ThingWriter, ThingAction and ThingQuery classes.

    In all likelyhood you’ll want to use either the ThingControlReactive controller (if you want to use the RxJava Observables directly) or, more likely, the full-blown ThingControl implementation, which extends both and additionally provides convenience method to get plain result Lists that block.

    For more details about the overall workings of this class check out ThingControl.

    • Method Detail

      • addChildThing

        public <V> Thing<V> addChildThing(Thing<?> parent,
                                  Thing<V> child)

        Add a child to a parent thing.

        Internally a reference to the parent is stored in the child object, which sounds counterintuitive. Doing it this way might slow done some types of queries, but it makes it easier to manage references between things in a de-coupled way. The writer of the child can decide how to store the relationship, and if the type/writer were to go away, the relationship disappears completely, along with the child. Whereas, otherwise there would be a reference in the parent object that could not be accessed anymore.

        Parameters:
        parent - the parent
        child - the child
        Returns:
        the updated child thing

      • saveThing

        public <V> Thing<V> saveThing(Thing<V> thing)
                       throws ThingException

        Saves or updates this thing.

        Make sure you use the return-Thing after saving, because depending on the underlying storage backend (ThingWriter), it might be that the old Thing is out of date (session-handling, etc…)

        Parameters:
        thing - the thing
        Returns:
        the persistent thing
        Throws:
        ThingException - if more than one ThingWriter was configured for the type/key combination of this thing
